name: Python Tutorials
body:
KAUST ACM Student Chapter is pleased to invite you to take part in a week of Python tutorials, February 23 - 27, 2014. **[Please register before attending](https://docs.google.com/a/kaust.edu.sa/forms/d/1FNVFwJ4rFLbTSLClk4ZTkJYNyDnEjFctbfXTb32u54w/viewform).**

## The schedule:

| Date              | Time                               | Tutorial        | Presenter        |
|-------------------|------------------------------------|-----------------|------------------|
| Sunday, Feb 23    | 10:30am - 12:00pm 2:00pm - 3:30 pm | Basics          | Tareq            |
| Monday, Feb 24    | 10:30am - 12:00pm 2:00pm - 3:30 pm | Intermediate    | Tareq & Yiannis  |
| Wednesday, Feb 26 | 10:30am - 12:00pm 2:00pm - 3:30 pm | Advanced        | Maruan & Yiannis |
| Thursday, Feb 27  | 2:00pm - 4:00pm                    | MPI with Python | Lisandro         |

The tutorials are logically split into 3 parts: Basics, Intermediate level, Advanced topics. Each tutorial level is given on a separate day. The morning sessions of the tutorials cover general Python topics of various levels; the afternoon sessions are devoted to specific techniques, packages, and problems that could be easily solved in Python. The final day will have a 2-hour session bout MPI programming in Python.

## Python Tutorials: Day 1 - Basics
This is a beginners' level session, in which we focus on the basic syntax of the language and essential functionality. The session is hand-on.

**General topics:**
Getting started with Python: Using iPython notebook, basic usage and syntax

**Special topics:**
Useful tools for automated script generation; terminal commands execution and parsing results; working with files: reading, parsing, using encodings, and writing to files.

## Python Tutorials: Day 2 - Intermediate topics
This session is focused on stepping beyond basics and also on some useful numerical packages used by scientists world wide: Numpy, SciPy, and Matplotlib. The session is hand-on.

**General topics:**
Python libraries, programming approaches in python, advanced syntax usage, input and output.

**Special topics:**
Scientific calculations with NumPy and SciPy, advanced plotting techniques with MatPlotLib.

## Python Tutorials: Day 3 - Advanced techniques
During this session we go further from procedural programming to object-oriented style and functional approaches widely used in professional Python programming. The session is hand-on.

**General topics:**
Classes and objects, object-oriented programming, functional programming, memory management.

**Special topics:**
Optimization in Python with OpenOpt; machine learning in Python with Scikit-Learn.

## Python Tutorials: Day 4 - MPI with Python
During this session you will learn about Message Passing Interface (MPI) programming approach in high performance computing and about how to work with it in Python. The session is lecture-like.
